properties.title: soapUI User Guide - for Web Service Testing

section.name: SoapUI User Guide
section.p: The soapUI User Guide aims at giving an overview of all features available together with some explanations on the underlying implementations. The User Guide covers both soapUI, its IDE Plugins and soapUI Pro, sections and pages related to soapUI Pro are clearly marked. Read the feature comparison between soapUI and soapUI Pro here.

tr.td: Gives an overview of the soapUI interface, prerequisites and general functionality
Gives an overview of the soapUI tabbed desktop, a soapUI Pro only feature
Gives an overview of the soapUI License Management, a soapUI Pro only feature
Explains soapUI global preferences
Gives an overview of the soapUI Pro only XPath Selection feature
Gives an overview of Web Service Coverage functionality (soapUI Pro only)
Explains how to manage workspaces in soapUI
Explains soapUI projects and how to work with them
Explains the Project View and its content tabs
Explains how to work with Project-level Coverage functionality (soapUI Pro only)
Explains how to work with Project-level Requirements functionality (soapUI Pro only)
Explains how to setup and configure WS-Security for your projects
Explains how to encrypt projects and global settings in soapUI
Explains how to use Composite Projects when working in Teams (soapUI Pro only)
Shows how project items are resolved during imports
Details on how WSDLs are visualized and how to work with them
Explains the integrated WSDL Viewer
Shows how to check WS-I Basic Profile compliance for your WSDLs
Shows how to refactor WSDLs and Test Items in your projects (soapUI Pro only)
Shows how Operations are visualized and handled
Shows how to invoke web service operations and work with the request editor
Shows the functionality of the Form Editor an editor that simplifies Inspection
Shows the functionality of the Form Editor an editor for Request/Response Overview

A quick introduction to get you started with functional testing

General Test Request functionality
Explains SOAP Test Requests and how to use them
Explains REST Test Requests and how to use them

Describes available response assertions and their usage
Shows the Editor Wizards. soapUI Pro only
Describes how to transfer property values between Test Steps
Shows how to control TestCase execution flow using the Goto Step
Shows how to use Groovy Script Steps to perform arbitrary functionality
The Properties Step can be used to handle global properties in a TestCase
The Delay Step can be used to create pauses in a TestCase
The Run TestCase Step can be used to modularize your Tests
The MockResponse Step can be used to create MockResponses in a TestCase
The DataSource Step can be used to collect data from a number of sources in a TestCase
The DataSource Loop Step can be used to loop a DataSource in a TestCase
The DataSink Step is used for writing property values to external storage
The DataGen Step is used to dynamically generate Test Data
Outlines soapUI LoadTesting functionality available for web services
